title: Spirit Visage has less HP than its components
body:
{{item:3067}} = 200
{{item:3211}} = 250
{{item:3065}} = 425

You gotta stop doing this, Riot.  You had the right idea with Hurricane by changing the build path.  If you don't want something to have particular stats, then *make it build out of something else*.  This stuff isn't hard.

I actually think stuff like this is good.

Items shouldn't be about efficiency but how valuable the active/effect is. It makes the game better and it removes some of the snowball potential of merely getting items. New GA is also the same; technically gold inefficient but the revive slot is what the meat is about.
The new GA doesn't give you worse stats for combining it.  The fact that I spend gold to lose HP is pretty bogus.

that was the old madred's though. i recall it being {{item:1043}} {{item:1037}} and the old jungle razor which did give some AD, but the final item only had 25 AD equivalent of just the {{item:1037}} alone. The AD drop was justified by the 4% max hp damage it did, which sort of made sense I guess, but SV passive isn't even that great to warrant a stat drop.
At some point it actually gave less ad than it's components, though later it was buffed to 40ad **so it would match it's components**.
gonna be real with you, tanks never bought spirit for its affect. they got it becuase it was the most efecient magic resist item.
Which IMO is fucking stupid. You should buy items to fit the situation. Not "I'm buying this because it's the most bang for buck". Especially in a strategy game.

> [{quoted}](name=The Lost Marbles,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=wrHYwg04,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-05-04T01:28:12.840+0000)
>
> What would you change the build path to? Just curious.

Just build from the Ruby Crystal and not the Kindlegem. That's -50 HP from the item, so the component HP is 400 and the item HP is 425. And since CDR isn't a basic stat anyway, losing the Kindlegem's CDR doesn't matter since that stat is always added in combines.

> [{quoted}](name=Espy Psyche,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=wrHYwg04,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2017-05-04T01:52:12.042+0000)
>
> Just build from the Ruby Crystal and not the Kindlegem. That's -50 HP from the item, so the component HP is 400 and the item HP is 425. And since CDR isn't a basic stat anyway, losing the Kindlegem's CDR doesn't matter since that stat is always added in combines.

The CDR does matter though. A lot of tanks value the CDR on Spirit; tank items are pretty limiting in the CDR area as is. If the CDR was gone from Visage, I think the only true tank item left with CDR would be Frozen Heart and Warmogs. I don't really consider Iceborn Gauntlet a "tank" item; its a bruiser item. They could just lower how much health Specter's Cowl gives instead.
That's not what he was saying. He's saying make the recipe Cowl + Ruby so there isn't any HP discrepancy and have the end result Spirit Visage just be what it is now.

CDR isn't a basic stat, like he said, it already appears as the "bonus" for completing the item with the combine cost. The same concept happens with {{item:3071}} , which only has 10% from {{item:3067}} but magically gets 20% when it's complete.
That is kinda weird.

In this case I'd just say you should bump SV by 25 HP. It's probably the worst of the MR/HP items ATM anyway and it sets itself apart with a higher HP value, so it seems like this wouldn't be a terrible solution. If you need to boost the price by a potion or so to do this, who really cares?

> It's probably the worst of the MR/HP items ATM anyway.

There are ~~two~~ now three of those in SR: {{item:3065}}, {{item:3001}}, and {{item:3194}}. Spirit visage gives over double the health, and the average MR. It also has, you know, it's _universal healing boost_. It's not bought for HP, it's bought for imperial shittons of regen. Yes, imperial shittons. We've gone past metric shittons.
Yeah, just throwing +25HP on it is really the simplest solution.
Not to mention Nomad's Medallion {{item:3096}}: {{item:3301}} + {{item:1004}}  = 25% health regen. Huh?
